item.name: Send a direct request to a registered device in Security Cloud Control

request.name: Send a direct request to a registered device in Security Cloud Control

description.content: Send a direct command to the specified device.
By default, the API waits up to 70 seconds for a device response. Append the 'async' flag to return immediately without waiting for the response.

response.name: The request was successfully processed, and the device command was executed.

description.content: By default, the API waits up to 70 seconds for a device response. Append the 'async' flag to return immediately without waiting for the response.
By default, the API waits up to 70 seconds for a device response. Append the 'async' flag to return immediately without waiting for the response.

request.name: Retrieve the response for a previously sent command

description.content: Get the response from a device for a command previously issued.
(Required) The unique identifier of the request, represented as a UUID, returned from a previous POST request to the /command endpoint.

response.name: The device responded. The response may indicate success or contain an error returned by the device.

description.content: Retrieve a list of supported device command endpoint patterns.

response.name: The list of supported command patterns.

item.name: Get time-series interface metrics for an ASA device

request.name: Get time-series interface metrics for an ASA device

description.content: Returns time-series interface metrics - including link status, overruns, and other key performance indicators - over a specified time range. Supports filtering by interface and metric. Pagination applies only when interface UIDs are not specified.
Start of the time range (ISO 8601 format).
End of the time range (ISO 8601 format).
Relative time range (mutually exclusive with start/end).
Maximum number of device records to return (used only when no deviceUids are provided).
Offset for pagination (used only when no deviceUids are provided).
Comma-separated list of interface UIDs to query. Max 50. If omitted, results are paginated.
Comma-separated list of metrics to return (e.g. linkStatus, overruns). Returns all if omitted.
(Required) The unique identifier, represented as a UUID, of the ASA device in Security Cloud Control.

response.name: Successfully retrieved time-series metrics for one or more interfaces.

description.content: Add a tenant to the MSP Portal by providing an API token for the tenant. Use this endpoint to add a tenant that the user performing the operation is not associated with, or a tenant in a different region to that of the MSP Portal. This is an asynchronous operation to add an existing tenant that the user making the API call is associated with to the MSP Portal. This endpoint will add an API-only user to the tenant, generate an API token for the API-only user, and add the tenant to the MSP Portal. Note: this endpoint can only be executed by a super-admin in the MSP Portal who is also associated with the tenant being added.
(Required) Unique identifier of the tenant to add to the MSP portal.

item.name: Provision cdFMC for Security Cloud Control tenant in MSP Portal

request.name: Provision cdFMC for Security Cloud Control tenant in MSP Portal

description.content: This is an asynchronous operation to provision a cdFMC for a tenant associated with the MSP Portal. This operation does not wait for the cdFMC to be provisioned on the target tenant, and will be marked as successful once the provisioning has been successfully triggered. To monitor the transaction on the target tenant, use the UID in the `TRANSACTION_UID_IN_TARGET_TENANT` key in the transaction details.
(Required) Unique identifier of the tenant that cdFMC provisioning will be enabled for.

response.name: Security Cloud Control Transaction object that can be used to track the status of the operation.

request.name: Remove users from Security Cloud Control tenant in MSP Portal

description.content: This is an asynchronous operation to remove a list of users from a tenant associated with the MSP Portal.
(Required) Unique identifier of the tenant from which the users will be deleted

response.name: Security Cloud Control Transaction object that can be used to track the status of the operation.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Create a new tenant in Security Cloud Control from an MSP Portal. This endpoint creates a tenant, adds the tenant to the MSP Portal. If the user creating the tenant is not an API-only user, the user is also added to the tenant. Note: This endpoint can only be executed by a super-admin in an MSP Portal. You can create no more than 1 tenant every 30 seconds. Additionally, you are limited to creating a total of 100 tenants: please speak to support to raise this limit.

response.name: Security Cloud Control Transaction object that can be used to track the status of the tenant creation.

The query to execute. Use the Lucene Query Syntax to construct your query. Possible fields to search by are name, content.
If enabled, the search will also include results from override objects.

Get information on an in-progress CDO transaction. An CDO transaction is an entity used to monitor progress of, and provide feedback on, long-running operations. All asynchronous operations in CDO's API create Security Cloud Control transactions.
(Required)

response.name: CDO Transaction that has completed, either successfully or unsuccessfully. Note: failed Security Cloud Control Transactions do not roll back.
